metadata.metaValue: Reverse, remove first point and mirror
Position the arch so that its upper right corner is in the origin
Scale the height of the arch to be max the height of the (right side of the) box

This adds an offset to each SIDE and to the TOP 

(NOT to the bottom)
I'm using the edge vectors to offset the points because I plan to make arches for quads that are non-rectangular
Special case when number of points is less than 2
Calculate the number of subdivs in the horizontal and vertical direction on the frame around the arch. Half the width and the full height of the arch are weigthed.
There is a bias towards vertical points.
Repeat arch template for all faces
Offset face vertex indices for subsequent faces
Add the two base points of the arch FRAME
If "extrude" is set then duplicate the portal points and move them along the face normal
Special case: no subdivs = two 5-sided + three 4-sided arch faces, one 5 Sided portal and five 4-sided extrude faces
Now fix four faces (start, end, 2x apex) to be triangles
Create the arch face and add it to the quads above the arch
Add two base points for the arch
For extrude there is a copy of the arch plus base points / sew the two rows together
Sew the frame points and the arch points with quads
Remove vertices and renumber the remaining
get the faces that become triangles / 4 in total: 1 start, 1 end, 2 around the apex
Create one "example" quad and repeat it
Create one "example" quad and repeat it
